chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lonnie Steele

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lonnie Steele in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Scheduling Conferene held.  Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial date.  Any motions are to be filed by November 1, 2022.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 30, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Stipulation and Order Regarding Use of Videotaped Statements signed and filed.  bm
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  bm

Defendant Lonnie Steele in court with Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn; both appear in person.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Detective Z. Thoms.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 12.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

Defendant Lonnie Steele not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with EAC; 
EMC; Z Q P (disclosure witness); HTR (disclosure witness); MPS (Except administrative functions); no contact with kids under 16

Defendant Lonnie Steele in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Lonnie Steele in custody.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lonnie Steele appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Defense counsel request to be heard on bail at preliminary hearing.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
